title: Branding refresh, cohesive backgrounds, video search, dashboard thumbnails, Nepali UI text, and Exam First Paper fix

requirements.summary: Support a user-provided custom app logo with safe fallback and use it on SplashScreen and Dashboard header
acceptanceCriteria: If a custom logo image exists at a documented static path (e.g., in frontend/public/assets/), the app renders it on SplashScreen and the Dashboard header.
If the custom logo asset is missing, the app continues to render the existing logo without runtime errors.
Logo sizing remains visually balanced on both mobile and desktop layouts.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable AppLogo component that attempts to load a custom static logo first (document the expected static path inside the component), and falls back to the existing generated logo asset when the custom logo fails to load (e.g., via image error handling).
Replace the hard-coded logo with the new AppLogo component so the splash screen uses the custom logo when present and gracefully falls back otherwise.
Update the Dashboard header logo rendering to use the AppLogo component, keeping sizing balanced and consistent with the existing header layout.

requirements.summary: Update dominant page background gradients to a cohesive, less blue-heavy palette across key pages
acceptanceCriteria: The primary page backgrounds no longer use the current blue/indigo-dominant gradients (e.g., from-slate-50 via-blue-50 to-indigo-50) on the specified pages.
Backgrounds look consistent across pages (same design language), while preserving readability/contrast in light and dark modes.
No layout regressions or unreadable text due to color changes.

requirements.summary: Add keyword search for subject videos (topic + video titles) and for bookmarked videos with real-time filtering and empty states
acceptanceCriteria: Each SubjectContent page provides a search input for the Videos section; typing filters the rendered topics/video items in real time (case-insensitive).
Search matches against video titles and topic titles; when filtering, only matching videos/topics are shown.
VideoBookmarks page provides a search input that filters bookmarked videos by title.
When search yields no results, the UI shows a clear empty state message (translated per REQ-25).

file_operations.description: Add a small utility for case-insensitive filtering of topics/videos by keyword, supporting matches against topic titles and video titles, and returning a filtered topic list suitable for rendering.
Add a Videos search input (stateful, real-time) and use the shared filtering utility to filter the Topics/Video list; render a Nepali empty-state message when no videos/topics match.
Adjust rendering expectations to work cleanly with filtered topic lists (e.g., ensure no assumptions about always-nonempty lists), while keeping selection/bookmark behavior intact.
Add a search input that filters bookmarked videos by title in real time (case-insensitive) and show a Nepali empty-state message when the filter yields zero results.

requirements.summary: Enhance Dashboard Kharidar Courses section with 3–4 static course thumbnails in a compact, responsive layout
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard displays 3–4 distinct course thumbnails within the Kharidar Courses section.
Thumbnails are responsive, do not overflow the card, and look good on small screens.
Thumbnails are served as static frontend assets (no backend involvement).

acceptanceCriteria: Core navigation and page headers no longer show English-only labels in the areas listed in this requirement (e.g., BottomNav labels, OldQuestions tabs, bookmark page titles, exam selection labels).
Common action buttons and empty states are translated consistently across pages.
No broken layouts due to longer/shorter translated strings.

requirements.summary: Fix Exam module to include First Paper option and prevent incorrect mapping to Second Paper content; show Coming soon when URLs are unavailable
acceptanceCriteria: Exam selection screen includes First Paper, Second Paper, and Third Paper options.
Selecting Second Paper still opens the existing Second Paper Drive URLs and uses a 45-minute timer.
Selecting Third Paper still opens the existing Third Paper Drive URLs and uses a 150-minute (2h 30m) timer.
First Paper does not display Second Paper title/URLs; if First Paper URLs are not configured, the UI shows a clear “Coming soon” state and prevents starting the timer for it.
No duplicate/misleading exam IDs or titles in the exam set configuration.

file_operations.description: Update the exam set configuration to include distinct First/Second/Third Paper entries with correct durations for Second (45) and Third (150), and represent First Paper as unavailable when URLs are not configured (without mapping it to another paper).

Update Exam selection UI to render First/Second/Third Paper options; disable or prevent starting the First Paper when URLs are missing and show a clear Coming soon state, while preserving existing Second/Third behavior (DriveViewer URLs + timer durations).
